concept.title: IPMI view tool is not working
concept.shortdesc: If there is a problem starting the KVM Console from the IPMI view, you might want to use the SoftLayer Portal.

section.title: KVM console fails to start from the IPMI view tool
section.p:
If you have an Authentication failed message, you can use the SoftLayer Portal site to start the KVM console by completing the following steps:
From the device list in the SoftLayer Portal site, choose the bare metal device that you want to install with and select Actions KVM console . The KVM Console is displayed.
From the KVM Console, select Remote Control Console Redirection and click Launch Console. A jnlp file (Java WebStart Application) is downloaded.You must have Java installed.
Open the .jnlp file by using Java Web Start (javaws). The Java Webstart application is started.
From the Java iKVM Viewer application, select Virtual Media Virtual Storage and choose the ISO file as the installation media.
From Virtual Storage, click CDROM&ISO and select Logical Drive TypeISO File.
Browse your system to find the installation ISO file and click Plug in to load the ISO file and connect and boot device.
Click OK.
From the Power Control menu, select Power Reset. The system power cycles and installation starts because the ISO file is at the beginning of the boot list.
